newsitem.title: LEBANON: Lebanon foreign debt reaches $1.798 bln in Jan.
newsitem.headline: Lebanon foreign debt reaches $1.798 bln in Jan.

text.p: Lebanon's foreign debt rose slightly to $1,797.6 million in January from $1,791.2 million at the end of December, the Bank of Lebanon said on Wednesday.
In its latest monthly bulletin, the bank said foreign debt stood at $1,304.9 million in January 1996.
Net total public debt rose to 16,433.0 billion pounds in January from 16,138.1 billion at the end of 1996. It stood at 11,690.4 in January 1996, the bank added.
"The increase in debt was mainly due to the rise in net domestic debt which reached 13,647.2 billion at end of January 1997, against 13,358.2 billion at end December 1996," the bank added.

The bank said the budget deficit was mainly financed by treasury bills subscribed by banks, which increased by 205 billion pounds in January to 12,760.8 billion pounds from 12,555.8 billion a month earlier.
January's budget deficit of revenue against expenditure was 253.6 billion pounds, according to finance ministry statistics issued last month.
It gave the following details on the country's debt:
